body:
## What happened

Occurred when selecting "Open Android module in Android Studio" from the flutter menu.

## Version information

Android Studio `Bumblebee | 2021.1.1 Patch 1` • Flutter plugin `io.flutter 64.1.2` • Dart plugin `211.7798`

Error getting Flutter sdk information.

## Exception

null

```
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/android/tools/idea/gradle/project/ProjectImportUtil
	at io.flutter.actions.OpenAndroidModule.canImportAsGradleProject(OpenAndroidModule.java:100)

	at com.intellij.util.SlowOperations.allowSlowOperations(SlowOperations.java:76)

	at com.intellij.openapi.application.TransactionGuardImpl.performUserActivity(TransactionGuardImpl.java:95)
	at com.intellij.openapi.actionSystem.impl.ActionMenuItem.fireActionPerformed(ActionMenuItem.java:110)

	at com.intellij.ui.plaf.beg.BegMenuItemUI$MyMouseInputHandler.mouseReleased(BegMenuItemUI.java:545)

	at java.desktop/java.awt.Component.dispatchEvent(Component.java:4859)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEventImpl(EventQueue.java:778)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:727)
	at java.desktop/java.awt.EventQueue$4.run(EventQueue.java:721)

Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.android.tools.idea.gradle.project.ProjectImportUtil PluginClassLoader(plugin=PluginDescriptor(name=Flutter, id=io.flutter, descriptorPath=plugin.xml, path=~\AppData\Roaming\Google\AndroidStudio2021.1\plugins\flutter-intellij, version=64.1.2, package=null), packagePrefix=null, instanceId=44, state=active)
	at com.intellij.ide.plugins.cl.PluginClassLoader.loadClass(PluginClassLoader.java:215)
	at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:522)
```

comment_data.body: It is complaining that the class `ProjectImportUtil` is missing. That class has been part of IntelliJ since 2014, so it isn't missing, but apparently not being found for some reason. This is likely a configuration issue. Check your environment variables to ensure everything is correct. You may need to re-install Android Studio. Make sure you don't have a file named `android.jar` on the Java class path, other than the one that ships with Android Studio (or IntelliJ). Let us know if that fixes the problem.
I didn't find the configuration issue, but reinstalling the IDE resolved the issue.

title: IDE Error in Android Studio
